item.title: Monopoly GO: How to Get Railway Scottie Token
item.description:
If you’ve grabbed the Railroad Xing Shield for your Monopoly GO board, you’ll now want to get your hands on the latest Railway Scottie Token . While these cosmetic skins don’t give you any special abilities, the railway esthetics bring a nostalgic and classic feel. You can show off your Railway Scottie Token by displaying it as your active playing piece on the Monopoly GO board, and it will also be visible on your Tycoon Card for other players to see. Read on to learn how you can get the Railway Scottie Token.

How to Get the Railway Scottie Token in Monopoly GO

The Railway Scottie Token features Mr. Monopoly’s Scottie Dog wearing a cap that resembles a classic conductor's or train engineer's hat. It’s playfully sticking its tongue out and wears a vibrant red bandana, giving it a friendly and whimsical expression.

To get the Railway Scottie token, players need to participate in the ongoing Tycoon Express Pass. This exclusive token is your reward for reaching Monopoly Class (Level 6) in the current Tycoon Express season.

To reach Monopoly Class, you'll need to score 140 Express Coins and upgrade your cabin. You can earn these Express Coins by participating in daily tournaments. Remember, your final rank on the tournament leaderboards directly impacts how many Express Coins you receive. The higher you place, the more coins you’ll get.

The availability of the Railway Scottie Token, and other rewards, is subject to change with each new season of the Tycoon Express event. While this token might currently be obtainable as a reward, there is no guarantee it will be featured in future seasons. If you're eager to add the Railway Scottie Token to your collection, make sure to give it your all this season.

All Classes in Monopoly GO’s Tycoon Express

As you gather Express Coins and upgrade your class, you'll unlock a bunch of rewards. With every class upgrade, you'll instantly receive exciting rewards like new shields, emojis, and special tokens, along with a permanent seasonal boost to your tournament earnings.

Here are all the classes in Monopoly GO ’s Tycoon Express and their rewards this season.

Classes

Points Required

Rewards

Tycoon Class

5 Express Coins

Emoji

Premier Class

20 Express Coins

Emoji

Deluxe Class

40 Express Coins

Blue Profile Frame

Elite Class

65 Express Coins

Teal Profile Frame

Supreme Class

100 Express Coins

Railroad Xing Shield and Pink/Teal Profile Frame

Monopoly Class

140 Express Coins

Railway Scottie Token

item.title: October 2025 is Now Ridiculously Stacked for Xbox Game Pass
item.description:
Summary

  • Three major games have already been confirmed for Xbox Game Pass in October 2025.
  • Keeper, Ninja Gaiden 4, and The Outer Worlds 2 are all coming to Game Pass that month.
  • More games are coming to Game Pass in October, but have yet to be announced.

Thanks to the Xbox Games Showcase, October 2025 is now looking like it will be an incredibly exciting month for Xbox Game Pass . With an Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscription, Xbox gamers get instant access to a massive library of games, as well as brand-new, day one releases that debut on the service.

Many would agree that 2025 has been one of the best years in Xbox Game Pass history. The first half of the year featured critically-acclaimed new additions like Blue Prince and Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 along with surprise shadow drops like The Elder Scrolls 4: Oblivion Remastered and Ninja Gaiden 2 Black . The second half of 2025 is starting to take shape when it comes to Xbox Game Pass, with October 2025 already looking especially impressive.

The recent Xbox Games Showcase was full of exciting Xbox Game Pass announcements, and by the end of it, it became clear that October 2025 is going to be one to remember for the subscription service. Three major Xbox Game Pass games were confirmed for October 2025, with Keeper , Ninja Gaiden 4 , and The Outer Worlds 2 all launching that month. Xbox Game Pass subscribers can mark their calendars for October 17, October 21, and October 29, respectively.

New Xbox Game Pass Games Coming in October 2025

  • Keeper - October 17
  • Ninja Gaiden 4 - October 21
  • The Outer Worlds 2 - October 29

Keeper is the new game from Double Fine, the acclaimed studio behind games like Psychonauts and Brutal Legend . It's a visually-striking puzzle/adventure game where players take on the role of a living lighthouse. Ninja Gaiden 4 , meanwhile, is the long-awaited fourth numbered installment in the action-packed 3D Ninja Gaiden games. And finally, The Outer Worlds 2 is a new sci-fi RPG from Obsidian that should greatly appeal to fans of the studio's other first-person games.

Getting three major day one games in a single month will ensure that October 2025 is a particularly exciting month for Xbox Game Pass subscribers. But chances are there will be even more games added to the service in October that haven't been revealed yet. New Xbox Game Pass games are added and confirmed on a regular basis, and fans won't know the full scope of what to expect from October until the month itself rolls around.

October is still months away, but there are still plenty of exciting day one Xbox Game Pass games to look forward to in the near future as well. Xbox Game Pass has a number of heavy hitters on the way for June 2025, including FBC: Firebreak and Rematch , while Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 and Wuchang: Fallen Feathers are coming in July. Gears of War: Reloaded will join Game Pass in August. The new game additions really aren't slowing down and should add up to make 2025 one of the absolute-best years in Game Pass history.

item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign Releases New Update for June 2025
item.description:
Summary

  • FromSoftware released update 1.01.2 for Elden Ring Nightreign on June 10.
  • The update fixes an issue with the Guardian's remembrance questline that prevented the Demon Merchant from appearing.
  • FromSoftware is actively working to add a duos game mode, but there's no release date for the highly requested feature.

FromSoftware has surprised Elden Ring Nightreign players by releasing its 1.01.2 update filled with tweaks and bug fixes on the morning of June 10. Elden Ring Nightreign was released on May 30 for PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, and PC. The title was an instant hit for FromSoftware, as it managed to pull in 3.5 million players within five days of its release.

Some players were surprised to see FromSoftware release another update, as it recently launched a patch meant to fix matchmaking in Elden Ring Nightreign . The update specifically targeted matchmaking issues related to remembrance quests, as players were having a difficult time finding groups with one of the objectives active.

In a recent post on Twitter, FromSoftware outlined what players can expect to see when they install Elden Ring Nightreign 's latest update. In order to release the patch, the game's servers were taken down for one hour on the morning of June 10. One of the bug fixes included in the update targets the boss Wormface, as some players found that they were unable to rescue teammates near death after the boss had used its grab attack on them.

Elden Ring Nightreign Releases 1.01.2 Patch Notes

One of the bug fixes addresses an issue with the Guardian's remembrance questline in Elden Ring Nightreign . According to the patch notes, the update fixes a bug where the Demon Merchant wouldn't appear on the map during the Guadian's remembrance objective "Find the Demon Merchant in Limveld." The patch notes also state that, even though the update is filled with important bug fixes, the developers are aware of more issues in the game and are actively working to fix them as soon as possible.

While many players were happy to see the 1.01.2 patch address a wide variety of bugs, a lot of people are waiting to find out when FromSoftware will release its highly requested duos mode in Elden Ring Nightreign . As of writing, players only have two options when signing up for an expedition. Gamers can choose to play solo or in a group of three, but a large portion of the community has been asking for a duos mode since the game was announced in December 2024. While FromSoftware hasn't provided a firm release date for the game mode, it cas confirmed that it is actively working to add the feature. With so much content to enjoy and even more on the way, many fans are feeling optimistic about the future of Elden Ring Nightreign .

Elden Ring Nightreign 1.01.2 Patch Notes

Bug Fixes

  • Fixed a bug where the Passive Effect “Add (Magic/Lightning/Holy) to Weapon”, when applied to a Bow, made the Physical attack power higher than expected.
  • Fixed a bug where some non-direct attacks of specific weapons’ skills would inflict the attribute attack power and status ailment of the weapon.
  • Fixed a bug where weapons with the “Projectile Damage Drop-Off Reduced” Passive Effect were not included in the loot pool of chests and felled enemies.
  • Fixed a bug where the Demon Merchant would not appear when some conditions were met during the Personal Objective “Find the Demon Merchant in Limveld” of Guardian's Remembrance.
  • Fixed a bug where Libra, Creature of Night would repeatedly perform some actions.
  • Fixed a bug that caused the game to become unstable under some circumstances during the battle against Adel, Baron of Night.
  • Fixed a bug where it was not possible to rescue a player who was near death after being grabbed by Wormface's grab attack.

NOTE : Although this update includes bugfixes, we are aware that similar issues may still occur under some conditions, and we are continuing to work on resolving them.

item.title: Stranger Than Heaven: Yakuza Meets Tarantino?
item.description: Ryu Ga Gotoku Studio's newest game send players back to early 20th century Japan. With a harder edge than their popular Like A Dragon series, Stranger Than Heaven's noir sensibilities see this developer enter a new era.

item.title: WWE 2K26 Should Tread Where Triple H and WWE Are Afraid to Go
item.description:
Not long ago on Twitter, Ron "R-Truth" Killings announced his departure from WWE , leaving many fans and even the locker room stunned. He had just main-evented Saturday Night's Main Event against his childhood hero John Cena, so the timing really couldn't have been worse, and he's easily been one of the most consistent and best comedy acts within the company. There was an outpouring of support for Killings, including "We Want Truth" chants from TV crowds. Then, to the shock of everyone, he returned at Money in the Bank to attack Cena and help Cody Rhodes and then-World Heavyweight Champion Jey Uso cinch the victory over Cena and Logan Paul. This shift in storytelling, a pivot so to speak, is something that WWE 2K26 would be wise to utilize, even if it's something that WWE and TKO don't really enjoy.

WWE 2K26 has not been revealed, but its development was confirmed in a recent 2K Financial Report alongside WWE 2K Mobile.

Does WWE Dislike Fans Hijacking Company Decisions?

According to sources like Fightful and Killings himself, none of this was a work. WWE cut him, realized it was a bad decision, and brought him back, with R-Truth negotiating the use of his real name Ron Killings for this seemingly final run. Reports indicate that WWE President Nick Khan had to get involved to get a response from Killings, but there have been no official company statements on this series of events. During the Money in the Bank Press Conference, Triple H dismissed a question about it by saying that "it's all part of the show." According to sources like Dave Meltzer, which should be taken with a grain of salt, WWE and TKO do not like it when the fans hijack the company and the show, particularly the creative process.

Past comments would seemingly support this. Triple H's dismissal of the question and previous comments that he doesn't like when fans say they "pivot" all suggest some truth to this, although it's worth noting the similarities between the We Want Truth chants and the We Want Cody movement from WrestleMania 40. Either way, historically, a massive company hating fans "hijacking" the story makes some sense. Regardless of the exact feelings of Triple H and other WWW higher-ups, it's clear they're not quick to say, "Yes, we made a mistake and we fixed it because fans wanted us to," but it would make a great addition to the gameplay of WWE 2K26 .

WWE 2K26 Should Give Fans Their Voice

A crowd can make or break a show of Raw, SmackDown, or any PLE. It's the strong reaction that WWE gets overseas that has no doubt led to some PLEs moving over there in recent years. It's hard to ignore how France reacted to superstars like AJ Styles or even began the trend of singing Randy Orton's theme song, and that shows just how important they are to the product. Perhaps the simplest way would be to use crowd reaction in WWE 2K' s gameplay, such as rewarding players who perform actions the crowds are calling for. It could really be as simple as giving players a finisher for getting a table and using it if the crowd chants that. There could be some kind of mini-game worked into taunts and moves similar to the mini-game around Trading Blows. But, really, it would be effective across the board.

WWE 2K26's Showcase Mode Could Put the Spotlight on Crowds

Crowds could work in any game mode in WWE 2K 's library. While Showcase Mode could incorporate crowds into its already task-based gameplay, it would also be cool if moments where crowds determined matches were the focus of a Showcase. Putting light on events like Daniel Bryan's Yes Movement (as an example since WWE doesn't have rights to him), the We Want Cody movement, and the We Want Truth movement (depending on how it develops from here) would be a ton of fun and ensure the WWE 2K Showcase matches are varied. There's a long history of matches where crowds were major factors and focusing on those for a crowd-driven Showcase would only be fitting. Something like the AJ Styles and Cody Rhodes match from Backlash would also be a good fit just based on the crowd's reaction.

A Movement Would Be Great for WWE 2K26's MyRise Story

The same could be said of MyRise; it would be awesome if players were put in a position where they had to make decisions to earn crowd approval, requiring a movement to make them stars. It shouldn't take away player agency in WWE 2K26 , but it would still be an awesome way to either get the crowd behind or against the player. Utilizing the crowd in the story would help WWE 2K26 stand out from its predecessors, which seems to be a constant goal with its MyRise stories.

Crowds Should Be More Involved in WWE 2K26's MyGM Mode

As it stands, crowds play a small role in MyGM Mode. Players see some of their reactions and they are important in determining winners, but they're pretty much an automatic guarantee as long as players utilize MyGM Mode's core features. Making players have to earn them more, listen to them effectively, and book more in accordance with what fans want, at least as an optional feature, would be fun. If players consistently don't book to keep them somewhat appeased, it would be interesting if "fan hijacking" was more common. In WWE 2K25 's MyGM Mode, Triple H occasionally suggests a match-up based on fan demand, but seeing more prominent fan demand and those playing a bigger role in booking could go a long way in fleshing out the mode. Something like how Drew McIntyre and Chelsea Green utilize social media could also serve as an inspiration.

These are just a couple of ideas, but they could go a long way across all of WWE 2K26 's game modes. Crowd reactions should always play a role in booking, alongside the skill of a wrestler, regardless of how WWE higher-ups feel about it. Fans have a voice, and being afraid of that voice and not listening to it results in a poorer product, not better booking. Maybe fans don't always know best and it's always good to surprise them, but there are certainly moments where they matter more than corporate decision-making. The We Want Truth movement is proof of that, and WWE 2K26 should run away with the fans.
